statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem graphically}\\ \text{Minimise and Maximise } Z=x+2y \\ \text{subject to the constraints} \\ x+2y \ge 100,\, 2x-y \le 0,\, 2x+y\le 200;\, x , y \ge 0

step.context: \text{Does this plot correctly represent the } \\ \text{feasible region given the constraints?}
step.reason: \text{Given the constraints the area would be }\\ \text{below } 2x+y=200 \text{ but above }x+2y=100 \\ \text{Further since }2x-y\text{ needs to be negative, }\\ \text{therefore it would also need to be above }2x-y=0\\ \text{since that is where y would be greater than 2x}

step.context: \text{What is the value of the Minimum} \\ \text{for the corner points as seen in the graph?}
step.reason: \text{Maximum and Minimum are calculated by }\\ \text{substituting the correct corner points into the }\\ \text{objective function } Z=x+2y \\ \text{Here maximum is at (0, 200) whereas miimum} \\ \text{is at all points joining (0, 50) and (20, 40)}
